a drug used to relax muscles, made from a poisonous substance taken from the deadly nightshade plant: Atropine can be used to increase the heart rate.
More examplesFewer examplesToday, doctors use the drug atropine, a purified extract of the plant Atropa belladonna, to dilate pupils before eye examinations. Nerve gas victims get atropine, a drug often used to treat heart attacks. You'll need to visit a vet, who will treat the dog with atropine, an antidote for the toxin.Many modern drugs, such as atropine, digitalis and reserpine, have been derived from folk remedies.
